results.title: Earth's interior
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Earth revealed”.
Seismic waves, earthquakes and close study of rocks can give insight into the structure of the Earth. This episode looks at the field of geophysics in order to determine what the three composite parts which make up the Earth’s structure, i.e. the crust, mantle and core, are like. Measuring the magnetism in the Earth and its magnetic fields, looking at heat flow and measuring the Earth’s gravity are discussed. Geophysical research links the study of gravity, magnetism and seismology in order to fully comprehend the complexity of our planet.

results.title: Organic evolution
results.creator_credit: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and Television Ontario
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in science: biology”.
Organic evolution traces the development of various theories of evolution. It begins with the Biblical account of creation and discusses the work of Mendel, Darwin and the Hardy-Weinberg law. Examines microscopic and macroscopic organisms, genetics, heredity, cell reproduction, breeding populations, hypothesis and observation. The six episodes are entitled: 1. “In the Beginning” 2. “Darwin, naturally” 3. “Factoring in Mendel” 4. “The Meiotic mix” 5. “The Population picture” 6. “Mutation and all that.”

results.title: Wave-partical duality
results.creator_credit: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and Television Ontario
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in science: physics”.
Traces the development of the various theories advanced to explain the behaviour of light, from the concepts of the ancient Greeks to current proven models. The contributions of Isaac Newtown, Christian Huygens, Thomas Young, Jean Foucault, Albert Einstein and others are outlined as are the reasons for the gradual acceptance of both particle and wave models and their eventual combination. The six 10 minute episodes are: 1. “The Particle model” 2. “The Wave model” 3. “The Electromagnetic model” 4. “The Quantum idea” 5. “Photons” 6. “Matter waves.”

results.title: World of Apu = World of Apu
results.creator_credit: Satyajit Ray and Satyajit Ray Production
results.brief_description: The third in the Apu trilogy, the scene opens in Calcutta, where Apu, now a jobless ex-student, dreams of becoming a writer. Extracted from this insular environment, Apu’s life changes when he visits a village and exchanges himself for the mad bridegroom. After his wife’s death during childbirth, Apu leaves Calcutta. His life becomes one filled with indifference. Apu’s journey back to the world is painful but ultimately fulfilling. This is a moving film, considered to be one of Ray’s best, perhaps because the theme is so profound: that without death there cannot be life. The music by Ravi Shankar adds to the film’s power. Based on the text by Bibhutibhusan Banerji.

results.title: Olympic glory the golden years: Aussies and Kiwis in sport
results.creator_credit: Denis Phelan, James Murray and Golden Years
results.brief_description: Featuring remarkable achievements from athletes the like of; Betty Cithbert, Australai’s “Golden Girl” who was only 18 when she smashed the Olympic record for the 100m dashand took home three gold medals; Dawn Fraser, the first Olympic swimmer of either sex to win the same event three times; Raelene Boyle, the super sprinter twice runner-up in the 200m track event, beaten by world record wins each time,; and Jack Lovelock who scored an incredible victory in one of the most hotly contested 1500m finals in Olympic history. Porduction based on the Big Fights Olympic library.

results.title: The Magic school bus explores the human body (PC)
results.brief_description: Join Ms. Frizzle and the class on a wacky trip into Arnold’s body. Along the way you will explore how the human body works as you discover a way out of Arnold and win the game. STYSTEMS REQUIREMENTS: A multimedia PC or compatible with a 486SX or higher microprocessor, 25MHz, 4MB of RAM, at least 5MB of available hard-disk space, double speed CDROM drive, 8-bit audio board, and SVGA display capable of 256 colours. MS-DOS operating system version 5.0 or later. Microsoft Windows operating system version 3.1 or later.

results.title: The magic school bus explores the solar system (PC)
results.brief_description: Take an interplanetary adventure as the Magic School Bus blasts off into the solar system. Ms Frizzle gets lost in space! It’s your mission to collect clues, discover the secrets of the solar system, and find the friz to win the game. SYSTEMS REQUIREMENTS: A multimedia PC or compatible with 486SX or higher microprocessor, 25MHz, 4MB of RAM, at least 5MB of available hard disk space, double speed CDROM drive, 8-bit audio board, and SVGA display capable of 256 colours. MS-DOS version 5.1 ot later, Microsoft Windows, version 3.1 or later.

results.title: Microsoft Gahan Wilson's the ultimate haunted house (MAC)
results.brief_description: Race against the clock to escape a creepy, spooky haunted house that changes every time you play. Designed by Gahan Wilson, “The Ultimate haunted house” has easy to access game help, and loads of eerie sound effects to make playing fun for monster lovers aged 8 and up. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Macintosh LC III or higher; system 7.0 or later; QuickTime 1.6.1 or later; 8 mb total RAM (or 5 Mb free RAM); double-speed CD-ROM drive; 13” or larger colour monitor.

results.title: Calcutta
results.brief_description: Calcutta is one of India’s largest cities. Paul Cox’s camera explores the lives of the poorest of its inhabitants. Filled with the vibrant sounds of Indian music, the culture of the people of Calcutta is rich and vital despite the harsh conditions in which they live.
results.description: Calcutta is one of India’s largest cities. Paul Cox’s camera explores the lives of the poorest of its inhabitants. Filled with the vibrant sounds of Indian music, the culture of the people of Calcutta is rich and vital despite the harsh conditions in which they live.
